definition: it is not too late (idiom)
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
(negative prefix)/not/no
evening/night/late

sentences.english: It is also what we need before it is too late.
sentences.chinese: 如果为时不晚，这也是我们所需要的。

sentences.english: Is it ever too late to start?
sentences.chinese: 要是没有，现在开始还为时不晚吧？

sentences.english: But it is not too late to protect biodiversity so that future generations can enjoy the goods and services it provides.
sentences.chinese: 现在开始保护生物多样性还为时不晚。

definition: it is not too late (idiom)
lit. to mend the pen after sheep are lost (idiom)/fig. to act belatedly/better late than never/to lock the stable door after the horse has bolted
it is not too late (idiom)
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
already too late
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
to repent
too late to be sorry
a prodigal son returned home is worth more than gold
pinyin: lang4 zi3 hui2 tou2 jin1 bu4 huan4

definition: lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
unhelpful/useless
too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.
as soon as possible/at the first opportunity/the sooner the better/before it's too late
time and tide wait for no man (idiom)
to see the error of one's ways/to make a clean break with one's past
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
